channel.title: SDK
channel.description:
OK, I've looked at my steam account, and it says I have SDK, but I have no idea how to access it (it's not in the 'my games' section)
help?

item.title: SDK
item.dc:creator: awmoose
item.description:
Thanks guys!

This may just be me, but it seems incredibly similar to an editor I already have;
ever heard of Serious Sam Editor?

Still, I really needed these tutorials, so thanks!

I’m still having trouble with the skybox. If I set it to hollow ‘-32’ (like in the video), then the actual map changes to the same colour as the skybox

Read full topic

item.title: SDK
item.dc:creator: DinoThrasher
item.description:
awmoose:

OK, it’s being installed right now. Whilst I wait, will someone post some screenshots, to give me an idea as to what it actually does

Your in luck, I’ll never actually use the SDK but I was bored and found these tutorials on youtube.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JPTqbrRQsbI&annotation_id=annotation_558394&feature=iv

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=r-IblzeE-4M&annotation_id=annotation_513626&feature=iv

Or you have the uber list:

https://ubermicro.proboards.com/index.cgi?action=display&board=tutorials&thread=765

Read full topic

item.title: SDK
item.dc:creator: Metritutus
item.description:
awmoose:

OK, it’s being installed right now. Whilst I wait, will someone post some screenshots, to give me an idea as to what it actually does

The SDK can do a variety of things. I use almost exclusively for trying to make maps (The Hammer editor). So that’s one thing you can do with it. It also contains a model viewer, and a choreography tool for creating facial animations (I think).

For more information on the SDK:

https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/SDK

Read full topic
